sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"切，砍"之意。
means: chop ： 指用刀斧连续猛力砍某物，以便砍断、切碎。
cut ： 普通用词，使用广泛。指用带刃工具的切、割、砍等的行动。
hack ： 指粗暴地乱剪、乱砍、乱劈。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: variant of chap
late Middle English (in the sense 'barter, exchange'): perhaps related to Old English cēap 'bargaining, trade'; compare with chap- in chapman

early 19th cent.: from Hindi chāp 'stamp, brand'. The original use was in the Indian subcontinent, and subsequently in China, to denote an official stamp or seal, later a licence or permit validated by such a stamp

encyclopedia.content: 定义和用法 chop() 函数从字符串的末端开始删除空白字符或其他预定义字符。 trim()函数可以清除字符串开始位置和结束位置的charlist中所示的字符，并将结果返回。 语法 chop(string,charlist) 例子 在本例中，我们将使用 chop() 函数从字符串右端删除字符： <?php$str = "Hello World!\n\n";echo $str;echo chop($str);?>以上代码输出的源代码： <html><body>Hello World!Hello World!</body>&

entry.def: If you chop something, you cut it into pieces with strong downward movements of a knife or an axe.

example.ex: Chop the butter into small pieces...

entry.def: A chop is a small piece of meat cut from the ribs of a sheep or pig.
When people chop and change, they keep changing their minds about what to do or how to act.

example.ex: Don't ask me why they have chopped and changed so much.
example.tran: 别问我为什么他们一会儿一个主意。

entry.tran: 将被取消(或关闭);(人)将被解雇
entry.def: If something is for the chop or is going to get the chop, it is going to be stopped or closed. If someone is for the chop, they are going to lose their job or position.

example.ex: He won't say which programmes are for the chop...
example.tran: 他不愿说哪些项目将被毙掉。

example.ex: I was both disappointed and amazed when I got the chop from the Wales team.
example.tran: 我被威尔士队解聘时，既失望又错愕。

means.word_mean: 1. a small cut of meat including part of a rib
2. a tennis return made with a downward motion that puts backspin on the ball
3. a grounder that bounces high in the air
3. strike sharply, as in some sports
